comment.author: 42264328@N00
comment._content: Aha! There is a description of this photo--NY Times, 22 December 1912--(link)The Attitude of Austria in the Eastern Question--from the OCR on Google, I guess The Central Figure (Without a Hat) is Consul Kirchknopf of New York, Hilski Pasha ... and Russian Ambassador at Constantiple de Giers, (with Derby Hat Below de Giers and to the right is another figure--looks like a Russian in a naval uniform. He is not identified in the article that I see. The article is quite lengthy--gives a lot of context. Wikipedia article on Nicholas de Giers (1820-1895) identifies his son: His son Mikhail Nikolayevich von Giers acted as last Imperial Russian Ambassador in Constantinople until the beginning of World War I in 1914. So the guy in the derby hat is Mikhail Nikolayevich von Giers--I don't see any biographical information on him, in a quick search, but this is a start. Edit: More on Kirchknopf, Hilmi Pacha. A New York Times article from 19 September 1912 (link) mentions briefly, "Acting Consul-General Kirchknopf", apparently of the Austro-Hungarian embassy in New York. "Hilmi Pacha" would appear to be Hüseyin Hilmi Pasha, an Ottoman diplomat. So this appears to be a diplomatic meeting of Turks, Russians, and Austro-Hungarians, the date apparently circa September, 1912. Location is New York , presumably.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks for providing this information and the link to the published photograph. We'll add it to the source catalog.

comment.author: 35607065@N06
comment._content: This picture was more likely taken in Vienna, as opposed to New York. The Huseyin Hilmi Pasa article suggests that in "October 1912, he was sent as Ottoman ambassador in Vienna"
